column4: my package manager isn't showing me all (almost no) apps i search for. can someone help
pastebin your /etc/apt/sources.list
http://pastebin.com/m1ae55608
you're file looks fine, what programs/applications are you looking for that isn't being found?
vlc; flash, opera etc
in a terminal type sudo apt-get install vlc  .. what does it give?
that is how i installed vlc
that works
possibly click the reload button in synaptic?
i have reloaded, and i have said sudo apt-get update as well
synaptic, apt-get, aptitude all read from the same sources list so why you're not seeing it in synaptic is unknown to me
well the main problem i am having is that i can't see a flash chat window i am trying to load.so i wanted to see what flash i installed
in firefox you could type about:plugins in the address bar and it will tell you what firefox is using
the following is installed: application/x-shockwave-flash Adobe Flash movie swf    application/futuresplash FutureSplash movie
any idea why the flash page loads bt show nothing
not really if other flash pages work for you. some sites require IE only browsers. i've run into that in the past
maybe it is the IE thing
that is a possibility. Firefox has a user agent switcher that can fool most sites.
how do i get that
add-ons for firefox search for user agent switcher
thnx will try that
